title: VITAL: A New Dataset for Benchmarking Pluralistic Alignment in Healthcare
author: Anudeex Shetty (University of Melbourne), Amin Beheshti (Macquarie University), Mark Dras (Macquarie University), Usman Naseem (Macquarie University), ...
relevance_why: The focus on pluralistic alignment in healthcare can enhance understanding and application of diverse health perspectives in sound event detection and audio generation tasks.
background: The task involves evaluating how well large language models (LLMs) can align with diverse human values, particularly in health-related scenarios with conflicting cultural and moral beliefs.
contribution: VITAL introduces a comprehensive dataset designed to benchmark pluralistic alignment techniques specifically within the healthcare domain, addressing the need for outputs that reflect diverse values.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Previous alignment methods focus primarily on average human preferences, often overlooking cultural diversity.
technical_comparison.novelty: This work proposes a dataset that captures 13.1K value-laden situations and 5.4K questions, enabling a more thorough evaluation of pluralistic alignment methods tailored for healthcare.

key_innovation: The focus on pluralism in a healthcare context is novel, as most prior datasets do not adequately represent diverse health beliefs and practices.
real_world_impact: By improving AI alignment in health applications, this research can contribute to better decision-making and communication in health-related contexts, potentially leading to improved healthcare outcomes.
limitations: While the dataset has been constructed comprehensively, it may not encompass all possible diverse health beliefs and values.

new_terms.pluralistic alignment: **Pluralistic alignment** refers to the adjustment of AI systems to recognize and incorporate a wide range of human values and perspectives, particularly in situations where these values may conflict.

open_sourcing: The VITAL dataset and code will be released post-acceptance.
